examples: ‘[S]hould any of the men discover you, certainly you will have one of their creeses up to the hilt in your guts.’

verbs.description: creese (third-person singular simple present creeses, present participle creesing, simple past and past participle creesed)

examples: Attributing this to accident, or some impropriety of conduct on the part of the sailor, he went to enquire personally into the affair; but had no sooner approached the head Boorghese, than the fellow creesed him also, and he fell dead at his feet.
